page.title: 17DRAGONVILLE INDUSTRIAL EST.1
page.content: The Dragonville Industrial Estate was set up in the aftermath of the Second World War.The original companies were quite large scale concerns which employed many local workers. Amongst the first of these concerns were Durham Engineering, Mono containers manufacturers of plastic and paper containers, and Bickers who produced clothing. Over the the years a much greater number of smaller units have developed but three large concerns have also appeared on the scene within the last fifteen years or so.Of these the best known is Mackays Carpets who have a world wide reputation for their Durham carpets and have developed their site at Dragonville at the expense of their former head-quarters within the city.
